meanings.definition: A fermented alcoholic beverage made from apples.
meanings.sent1: I enjoyed a glass of cyder with my meal.
meanings.sent2: The farmer sold bottles of cyder at the market.
meanings.sent3: The cyder was so bubbly, it tickled my nose when I drank it.
meanings.sent4: The scent of cyder filled the room, reminding me of autumn days.
meanings.sent5: The golden color of the cyder shimmered in the sunlight, tempting me to take a sip.

meanings.sent1: The orchard workers cydered the apples to create a delicious drink.
meanings.sent2: She learned how to cyder her own batch of apple beverage.
meanings.sent3: I tried to cyder my own drink, but it turned out too sour.
meanings.sent4: The family tradition was to cyder a fresh batch of apple drink every fall.
meanings.sent5: The process to cyder the apples was time-consuming but rewarding in the end.
